required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Retinal Health Monitoring System Thickness Module
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Retinal Health Monitoring System - Retinal Thickness Module in Subjects With Normal Macular Thickness and Subjects With Center-involving Macular Edema

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate the ability and accuracy of the Retinal Health Monitoring System - Retinal Thickness Module (RHMS - RTM).

detailed_description.textblock: Evaluation of the Retinal Health Monitoring System - Retinal Thickness Module in subjects with normal macular thickness and subjects with center-involving macular edema.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the RHMS-RTM retinal thickness measurements
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate the ability of the RHMS-RTM device to measure retinal thickness

secondary_outcome.measure: Repeatability of RHMS-RTM retina thickness measurements
secondary_outcome.description: To assess repeatability of the RHMS-RTM device

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of retinal thickness measurements between the RHMS-RTM and the SD-OCT
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the agreement of measurements by the RHMS-RTM and SD-OCT
To evaluate the feasibility of intra- and sub-retinal fluid detection

arm_group.description: Subjects with normal macular thickness in one or both eyes.
Subjects with center-involving macular edema due to wAMD in one or both eyes
Subjects with center-involving macular edema due to DR or RVO in one or both eyes

intervention.other_name: Handheld swept source (SS) optical coherence tomography (OCT)

study_pop.textblock: Subjects aged ≥ 50 years old with normal macular thickness, center-involving macular edema due to wAMD, diabetic retinopathy or retinal vein occlusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age ≥50.
2. Corrected visual acuity (VA) of 20/125 or better, in the study eye(s)
3. Media clarity, undilated pupil size, and subject cooperation sufficient to obtain adequate OCT B-scans in the study eye(s)
4. Able to perform self-testing of retinal thickness with the RHMS-RTM after training
5. Able and willing to provide written informed consent before undergoing any study-related procedures
6. Group 1: Macula with normal thickness [central subfield thickness (CST): <305μm in women, and <320μm in men as measured by Heidelberg Spectralis SD-OCT in at least one eye. Patients diagnosed with dry AMD are eligible for enrollment into Group 1. No history of wAMD, DR, or RVO in either eye
7. Group 2 and Group 3, in at least one and the same eye: History of center-involving macular edema due to wAMD (Group 2); or DR or RVO (Group 3); Macular edema on SD-OCT with CST ≥305 μm in women, and ≥320μm in men as measured by Heidelberg Spectralis SD-OCT.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History of corneal refractive surgery [e.g., laser-assisted in situ keratomileusis (LASIK), photorefractive keratectomy (PRK), radial keratotomy (RK)] in the study eye(s)
2. History of epiretinal membrane, vitreomacular traction, or macular hole in the study eye(s)
3. Participation in any study using an investigational drug within 30 days of screening or an investigational device within 60 days of screening
4. Refractive error within defined limits
5. History of photocoagulation laser scar or other retinal scar in the central 3 mm of the macula, in the study eye(s)

facility.name: Inselspital, University Hospital Bern, Department of Ophthalmology
